radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is distended with shadowing stones and sludge along with a 6 mm obstructing stone at the gallbladder neck/cystic duct. There is equivocal prominence of the gallbladder wall measuring 3 mm. Evidence of a common bile duct stent with greater dilatation of the proximal common bile duct measuring 10 mm and prominence of the common hepatic duct measuring 4 mm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Previously demonstrated hemangiomas are better characterized on recent abdominal ultrasound. Greater dilatation of the proximal common bile duct compared to earlier assessments raises concern for stent malfunction.
